pros: Responsive and available upper management. Advancement and education opportunities. Patient first atmosphere.

review_title: An ok place to work in a town with very few full time options.
pros: Full time in a small town with not a lot of options. Benefits are decent and slightly better than what would be expected of a small-medium sized company in a rural area. LGBTQ+ friendly.
cons: Bare minimum pay, they routinely tout the "fairness" of the pay. Raises are about average but not keeping up with inflation. Dean Germano is considerate of employees on this front and facilitated an increase for inflation ahead of the typical merit increase interval for the year. Rigid policies and thinking. HR leaves much to be desired. ZERO work from home utilization except for the favored few. Extremely high turn over Poor management candidates in general with some exceptions. Almost no opportunity for advancement outside of incurring debt by going to school or having a Bachelor's when it doesn't have to be at all related to the field. The work does NOT need a Bachelor's by any means.

review_title: For the most part it's a decent place to work.
pros: Full time employment with workdays consisting of weekdays and occasional weekends. Pay is comparable to others in the area.
cons: Micro management in action. Some lack of concern for patient rights.

pros: The atmosphere becomes very family like in the midst of it all. And everybody is seeking the best outcome for the patient.
cons: The company itself does lack some in compensation for its employees and the health insurance could be much better.

review_title: Ability to Move Up but a Ton of Drama
job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Redding, CA
pros: Ability to move to different departments, positions, or shifts if applicable.
cons: Job is stressful, co workers are petty. Upper management fired people for little to no infractions.
